intro: Triblemma ovatum, commonly known as the smooth thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically purple or violet in color. Its fruits are toxic and resemble small apples, containing alkaloids that can be harmful to humans and animals. Triblemma ovatum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
